Detailed Description

Base class for all interface panes.

Member Function Documentation

void DzPane::buildOptionsMenu ( DzActionMenu *  menu  )  const [inline, virtual, slot]

Sub classes must reimplement this function to generate a default options menu if they have one. This function is called when the pane is loaded for the first time or the interface is reset. Otherwise, the option menus are loaded from the user's interface settings file.

Parameters:
menu The menu to add to

Reimplemented in DzHierarchyPane.

QString DzPane::getLabel (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The label of the pane.
DzActionMenu * DzPane::getOptionsMenu (  )  const [slot]
Returns:
The DzActionMenu for the pane.
Attention:
This function should not be used for adding a DzAction to a pane's option menu. Doing so defeats the user's ability to customize their interface settings. Instead, adding an action should be accomplished by reimplementing DzAction::getDefaultMenuPath().
Number DzPane::getOptionsMenuVersion (  )  const [inline, virtual, slot]

Sub classes must reimplement this function to provide the interface manager with the ability to update the user's settings file when the pane's default menu has changed. This function should return a value of 1 or greater if the pane provides a menu. Each time the default menu changes, this number should be incremented.

Reimplemented in DzHierarchyPane.

void DzPane::setBackgroundFooterGuide ( QWidget *  guideWidget  )  [protected]

Sets a background footer guide widget for the pane.

If this is set, a footer is drawn as part of the pane's background (controlled by the DZ_PE_PaneBackgroundFooter style primitive). The background footer primitive is the same size as the pane itself, with the top extent shifted to match the guide widget's top edge.

Parameters:
guideWidget The new guide widget. It should be a child widget (or grandchild, etc.) of the pane. If NULL is passed, any previous guide will be cleared.
void DzPane::setBackgroundHeaderGuide ( QWidget *  guideWidget  )  [protected]

Sets a background header guide widget for the pane.

If this is set, a header is drawn as part of the pane's background (controlled by the DZ_PE_PaneBackgroundHeader style primitive). The background header primitive is the same size as the pane itself, with the bottom extent shifted to match the guide widget's bottom edge.

Parameters:
guideWidget The new guide widget. It should be a child widget (or grandchild, etc.) of the pane. If NULL is passed, any previous guide will be cleared.

void DzPane::showPane (  )  [slot]

Shows this pane in the interface.

DzPane::tabBarHiddenChanged ( bool  hidden  )  [signal]

Emitted when the visibility of the pane's tab bar is changed. When the tab bar is hidden, it's options menu is not visible. If desired, pane instances can listen to this signal to know when the menu is hidden in order to provide an alternate method of accessing the menu options

Parameters:
hidden If true, then the tab bar is hidden
DzPane::visibilityChanged ( bool  onOff  )  [signal]

Emitted when the pane is shown or hidden.

Parameters:
onOff If true the pane is visible
